data.message: I used to like you marshall...now you are just another hypocritical scumbag...its so nice to be rich and act all tough in front of a movie camera...you are a moron...you just lost half your audience you mother f*cking coward

replies.message: I bet you he would say this right to drumpf if given the chance. But why would the president allow that? He can barely string two sentences together without sounding like an idiot.

I would not say this was cowardice in the least! He just spat 'I draw a line in the sand!' I would say that means that anyone who supports the imbecile that is Trump has a choice and Em is giving them that choice. I know which side of the line I'm on and I ball up my fist raise it high and am proud to stand with Em. You resort to being playground in an adult world, go play in the sand.

Why do people say that if you're rich it means you shouldn't speak out? If anything you have more of a responsibility too because you have a platform. And maybe some people just aren't as selfish as to say "well the system worked for me so fuck everyone else". And on top of all of that even if he is wrong, even if it IS disrespectful - well ain't that what's supposed to be so great about American? That freedom of speech thing? Or is it only applicable if you agree with what's said?
